pullrequest.title: Also store gazebo and ROS logs in S3

content.raw:
Does `set -e` exit the script if anything goes wrong? Sometimes one of these logs may not exist due to a crash. It's important that we still upload other logs like `cloudsim-docker.log` so we can debug the problem. 

e.g. I just had this error:

~~~
cp: cannot stat '/home/ubuntu/code/simulator-logs/world_3_2017-06-05T20-50-13-176Z/gazebo-server/diagnostics': No such file or directory
~~~

and I didn't see the line `'finished copying logs to s3 mnt folder'` printed. Maybe we remove the `set -e` so the remaining commands get executed?
content.html:
Does set -e exit the script if anything goes wrong? Sometimes one of these logs may not exist due to a crash. It's important that we still upload other logs like cloudsim-docker.log so we can debug the problem.

e.g. I just had this error:

cp: cannot stat '/home/ubuntu/code/simulator-logs/world_3_2017-06-05T20-50-13-176Z/gazebo-server/diagnostics': No such file or directory

and I didn't see the line 'finished copying logs to s3 mnt folder' printed. Maybe we remove the set -e so the remaining commands get executed?
